channel.title: Goldsource programming help
channel.description: can anybody please help me? i want to create a hl1 mod i got visual C++ 6.0 and the sdk and the source code but i cant find a proper tutorial can anyone help?

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Try “Suddenly, ZOMBIES. EVERYWHERE.” If you use that, though, I expect my name in the credits.

Also, mod Source. GoldSource is cool and retro and I definitely still play GoldSource mods whenever they come out, but Source is so much more versatile, and the gameplay is so much deeper and more dynamic.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
never encountered that error

make sure you have no leaks on the map (all the entities must be enclosed in brush surfaces) if that is not clear imagine a vacuum tube, no air should be able to get into the room where the player exists

Read full topic

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

i have no problem modding but mapping is a problem i can create maps but it always show atleast 1 error if you could help me i would appreciate it

You have to tell us what that error is first.

My first guess, however, would be that you didn’t enclose the map. Make sure that your map is enclosed on all sides or else your map won’t work because it is considered a “leak.”

Read full topic

item.description:

the skill required to fix all the problems you’re having with source is way less than to be able to mod for GoldSrc

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: pyjamasbox
item.description:
JeffMOD:

I beg to differ, some mods are quite good looking even on ye olde engine(eth).

I admit that it looks good for the engine, but it still looks worse then most low-end HL2 engine stuff. If you’re trying to create a believable atmosphere, then you probably want to be able to put more polygons out and have those extra effects.

It’s maybe not especially important for all mods, but if you ever intend to release a mod that is supposed to scare and/or make you feel like you’re living in that world, you’re not going to do it with the hl1 goldsrc engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
pyjamasbox:

the engine just doesn’t hold up well enough to take any mod seriously anymore.

I beg to differ, some mods are quite good looking even on ye olde engine(eth).

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: pyjamasbox
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

its outdated yes but still there are many good mods check moddb and look check

That said, only a small fraction of people will ever play a goldsrc mod. I played “they hunger” recently, and the engine just doesn’t hold up well enough to take any mod seriously anymore.

Do source. If you want something a bit easier on the system, purchase UT2004 and figure out how to mod for that engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

im using the source now but i would like to try the goldsource engine

Why? You realize GoldSource is outdated and no longer actively developed, right? Source is GoldSource’s successor.

How much experience do you have with C++ coding? If the answer is ‘none’, I’d start with a C++ tutorial.

Read full topic

source, or goldsource? they’re two seperate engines.

im using the source now but i would like to try the goldsource engine

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: pyjamasbox
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

my problem with those engines is that my computer isn’t strong enough to handle them so im using source for now

source, or goldsource? they’re two seperate engines.

also, unity isn’t too graphic intensive for your PC, you can build IPHONE games on it for fucks sake.

that said, i too tried to find some good tutorials on getting into HL2 modding, but found so little on the subject that i just said nothankyou.jpg.

it’s unfortunate, especially since 80% of the people who figure out how to mod the source engine are making terrible mods.

Read full topic

item.title: Goldsource programming help
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
ManlyStump:

Is there a reason to stick to Valve’s engines? If you haven’t got anything specific in mind you mind want to look into other engines. UDK and Unity for example are great for being user friendly and are highly geared towards people new to the field.

my problem with those engines is that my computer isn’t strong enough to handle them so im using source for now

Read full topic
